learning_outcomes.description: Develop an understanding of the physical quantities relevant to the electronic properties of crystals.
Develop an understanding of how quantum mechanics and statistical mechanics can be used to understand the electronic properties of crystals.
Understand the respective assumptions, successes and failures of the Drude, Sommerfeld and Bloch models for the electronic properties of crystals.
Understand how Blochs theorem leads to energy band structures for crystals.
Understand how the crystal structure of a material can determine whether it is a metal or insulator.
Understand how the band structure of a material determines its electronic and optical properties.
Understand the basics of amorphous solids
Solve simple quantitative problems and produce answers with the correct physical units.
Develop an understanding of magnetism and superconductivity as collective many-body phenomena due to the interactions between electrons.
Have a feel for the orders of magnitude of relevant physical quantities.
Appreciate that condensed matter physics is a diverse and exciting field with many outstanding problems.
Be able to relate theory and experiment.
